get.description:
This endpoint is for analytics purpose, if you want to analyze the limit orders data, this endpoint return all the orders that have been made, including the ones that have been cancelled or fully filled. 

The results could be very large, so each time we returns at most 1000 orders, you can use the resumeToken to fetch the next page. 

To get limit order for filling, use the [Get limit orders to match by YT addressâ€‹](#tag/limit-orders/get/v1/limit-orders/takers/limit-orders) endpoint!

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Chain id to filter by, leave blank to fetch all chains.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return. The parameter is capped at 1000.

parameters.name: maker
parameters.description: Maker address to filter orders by

parameters.name: yt
parameters.description: Market address to filter orders by

parameters.name: resumeToken
parameters.description: Resume token for pagination

200.description: Returns limit orders with resume token

get.summary: Get all limit orders for analytics

get.description:
This have the same interface and usecase as the endpoint above, but it returns the archived orders

When an order is not fillable anymore, we **might** archive it to save storage space, to fetch it, use this endpoint.

So to fetch full limit orders in history, using this and the endpoint above. Not all orders are archived, it depends on some conditions.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Chain id to filter by, leave blank to fetch all chains.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return. The parameter is capped at 1000.

parameters.name: maker
parameters.description: Maker address to filter orders by

parameters.name: yt
parameters.description: Market address to filter orders by

parameters.name: resumeToken
parameters.description: Resume token for pagination

200.description: Returns archived limit orders with resume token

get.summary: Get all archived limit orders for analytics

get.description:
This endpoint let you fetch limit orders of a user in a market, it have more filter options than the analytics endpoint but have less item per page than the analytics endpoint.

This limitation is more than enough for most use cases, given that a user can only have 50 orders per markets.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of results to skip. The parameter is capped at 1000.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return. The parameter is capped at 100.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: ChainId

parameters.name: maker
parameters.description: Maker's address

parameters.name: yt
parameters.description: Order's YT address

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: LimitOrderType { 0 : TOKEN_FOR_PT, 1 : PT_FOR_TOKEN, 2 : TOKEN_FOR_YT, 3 : YT_FOR_TOKEN }

parameters.name: isActive
parameters.description: isActive=true to get all maker's active orders, isActive=false otherwise and do not set isActive if you want to fetch all maker's orders

get.summary: Get user limit orders in market

post.description: Generate the limit order payload for signing with your private key/wallet
post.summary: Generate limit order data for signing

post.description: Generate multiple limit order (scaled) payloads for signing with your private key/wallet
post.summary: Generate list of limit orders (scaled) for signing

get.description: This endpoint returns best matching limit orders for a given YT address.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of results to skip. The parameter is capped at 1000.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return. The parameter is capped at 100.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: ChainId

parameters.name: yt
parameters.description: Order's YT address

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: LimitOrderType { 0 : TOKEN_FOR_PT, 1 : PT_FOR_TOKEN, 2 : TOKEN_FOR_YT, 3 : YT_FOR_TOKEN }

get.summary: Get limit orders to match by YT address

get.description:
USD prices for assets, this endpoint support all tokens that are available in Pendle App, including non-Pendle tokens (like USDC, USDT, etc.). 

Price are updated every minute. 

To get real-time price of YT and PT, use the [swapping-price](#tag/sdk/get/v1/sdk/{chainId}/markets/{market}/swapping-prices) endpoint.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Token ids to data for (comma-separated), leave blank to fetch all tokens. Up to 20 ids allowed.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Chain id to filter by, leave blank to fetch all chains.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of results to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return. Leave blank to fetch all results.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Asset types to filter by (comma-separated). Valid values: `PENDLE_LP`, `SY`, `PT`, `YT`. Leave blank to fetch all assets types.

200.description: Assets chainId-address mapped to their current USD prices across all chains.

get.summary: Get asset prices by IDs

get.description:
Historical price data for PT / YT tokens / LP tokens. We do not support historical price for **SY and non-Pendle tokens**.

The data is OHLCV data, returns in CSV format with open, high, low, close prices and volume. 

Please note that in case of LP, volume data will be 0. To get the correct volume, please use our `notional-volume-by-market` bellow. 

Returns at most 1440 data points. Computing unit cost is max(3, result length / 100)

parameters.name: time_frame
parameters.description: Time interval for OHLCV data aggregation. Valid values: `hour`, `day`, `week`.

parameters.name: timestamp_start
parameters.description: ISO Date string of the start time you want to query

parameters.name: timestamp_end
parameters.description: ISO Date string of the end time you want to query

200.description: OHLCV data in CSV format with time, open, high, low, close, volume.

get.summary: Get PT / YT / LP historical price by address

get.description:
Notional trading volume data for a specific market.

Returns at most 1440 data points. Computing unit cost is max(3, result length / 100)

parameters.name: time_frame
parameters.description: Time interval for OHLCV data aggregation. Valid values: `hour`, `day`, `week`.

parameters.name: timestamp_start
parameters.description: ISO Date string of the start time you want to query

parameters.name: timestamp_end
parameters.description: ISO Date string of the end time you want to query

get.summary: Get market volume by address

get.description:
Returns list of PT, YT, LP, SY assets supported in Pendle App, including: name, symbol, address, decimals, expiry (if applicable), icon.

Can filter by chain id, asset id, asset type.

Price are not included in the response.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Token ids to data for (comma-separated), leave blank to fetch all tokens. Up to 20 ids allowed.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Chain id to filter by, leave blank to fetch all chains.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of results to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return. Leave blank to fetch all results.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Asset types to filter by (comma-separated). Valid values: `PENDLE_LP`, `SY`, `PT`, `YT`. Leave blank to fetch all assets types.

get.summary: Get supported PT, YT, LP, SY assets

get.description:
Get whitelisted markets list with its metadata across all chains.

The data returns contains: market name, expiry, yt/pt/sy addresses, liquidity, trading volume, underlying apy, swap fee APY, pendle APY, fee rate, yield range, total pt, total sy in market, total supply of LP token, lp wrapper address (if applicable), etc. 

You can use chainId, isActive or ids params to filter markets.

parameters.name: isActive
parameters.description: Filter to active or inactive markets

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Filter to markets on a specific blockchain network

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Market ids to fetch metadata for (comma-separated), leave blank to fetch all markets. Up to 20 ids allowed.

get.summary: Get whitelisted markets list

get.description: Get all markets that have points. This endpoint returns the points configs and market id, to fetch market metadata, use the endpoint above.

parameters.name: isActive
parameters.description: Filter to active or inactive markets

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Filter to markets on a specific blockchain network

get.summary: Get points market

get.description:
Returns the latest/historical market data for a given market address.

If timestamp is given, it will return the historical market data at the given timestamp. Otherwise, it will return the latest market data. 

This endpoint have have: market liquidity, trading volume, underlying APY, implied apy, apy breakdown, voter apys, ...
get.summary: Get latest/historical market data by address

get.description:
Returns the time-series data for a given market. Useful to draw charts or do data analysis. 

This endpoint supports field selection via the `fields` query parameter. Available fields include: timestamp, maxApy, baseApy, underlyingApy, impliedApy, tvl, totalTvl, underlyingInterestApy, underlyingRewardApy, ytFloatingApy, swapFeeApy, voterApr, pendleApy, lpRewardApy, totalPt, totalSy, totalSupply, ptPrice, ytPrice, syPrice, lpPrice, lastEpochVotes, tradingVolume.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response. Use `all` to include all fields. Available fields: timestamp, maxApy, baseApy, underlyingApy, impliedApy, tvl, totalTvl, underlyingInterestApy, underlyingRewardApy, ytFloatingApy, swapFeeApy, voterApr, pendleApy, lpRewardApy, totalPt, totalSy, totalSupply, ptPrice, ytPrice, syPrice, lpPrice, lastEpochVotes, tradingVolume.

parameters.name: includeFeeBreakdown
parameters.description:
Whether you want to fetch fee breakdown data. Default is false. If enable, the response will include 3 fields: explicitSwapFee, implicitSwapFee, limitOrderFee And computing unit cost will be doubled. 

Fee breakdown is only available for daily and weekly timeframes.

get.summary: Get market time-series data by address

get.description: Get the amount required to swap in the market to change the implied apy to a given target, including liquidity from order books and AMM

parameters.name: targetImpliedApy

get.summary: Get market liquidity depth by address

get.description:
The data returned contains:

- monthly revenue
- pendle token supply
- pool vote, swap fee, apr of this epoch and last epoch
- pool cap for this epoch and expected cap for next epoch
get.summary: Get vePendle statistics

get.description: Weekly market fees across all markets, grouped by epoch (starting Thursdays).

parameters.description: Should be rounded up to time frame (in UTC)

get.description:
Return price by swapping  1 unit underlying token to PT/ YT, and 1 unit of PT/YT to the underlying token.

One unit is defined as 10**decimal. The result is updated every block.

Implied APY of the market is also included.

200.description: Return the swap output. Data is returned with corresponding asset decimals. Null indicates that it's not possible to swap the quantity, either because the market has insufficient liquidity or the market has matured.

get.summary: Get real-time PT/YT swap price of a market

get.description: Automatically identifies the action based on your input/output tokens. Supports swap, add-liquidity, remove-liquidity, add-liquidity-dual, remove-liquidity-dual, mint, redeem, mint-sy, redeem-sy, transfer-liquidity, roll-over-pt, and exit-positions.

parameters.name: receiver

parameters.name: enableAggregator

parameters.name: tokensIn

parameters.description: Input token amounts

parameters.name: tokensOut
parameters.description: Output token addresses

parameters.name: redeemRewards

parameters.name: needScale
parameters.description: Aggregators needScale value, only set to true when amounts are updated onchain. When enabled, please make sure to buffer the amountIn by about 2%

parameters.name: additionalData
parameters.description: Available fields: `impliedApy`, `effectiveApy`. Comma separated list of fields to return. For example: `field1,field2`. More fields will consume more computing units.

parameters.description: Transaction type to filter by. Valid values: `TRADES`, `LIQUIDITY`.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of results to skip. The parameter is capped at 1000.

parameters.name: limit

get.summary: Get market transactions by address

get.description:
Returns a list of unique wallet addresses that have interacted with a specific token across Pendle markets. 

Use the optional `chainId` parameter to filter results to a specific chain, or omit it to get users across all chains. 

Common use cases include:
- Token holder analysis
- User adoption metrics
- Market participation statistics

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Token address to query. Can be any Pendle token (PT, YT, SY, LP). Address will be normalized to lowercase.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Optional chain ID to filter results. If provided, returns only users who interacted with the token on the specified chain. If omitted, returns users across all chains where the token exists.

200.description: Array of unique wallet addresses that have interacted with the specified token.

get.summary: Get distinct users for a specific token

get.description:
Return all user PT/YT/LP/SY positions across all supported chains.

All the claimable rewards are cached by 24 hours. If you need the real time claimable data, use read it from RPC!

parameters.name: filterUsd
parameters.description: Minimum USD value threshold to filter positions

get.summary: Get user positions by address

get.description: Return all transactions related to a user, including limit order fill transactions, merkle reward distribution

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of results to skip. The parameter is capped at 1000.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return. The parameter is capped at 1000.

get.summary: Get user transaction by address

info.title: Pendle V2 API Docs
info.description:
## Terms used in the documentation/API

Below are some terms used in the documentation/API:

- Pendle Assets/Tokens: PT, YT, LP, SY
- Non-Pendle Assets: other tokens that are not Pendle assets, such as USDC, USDT, DAI, etc.
- Asset ID/Token Id: Is the combination of chain id and token address, e.g. 1-0x5fe30ac5cb1abb0e44cdffb2916c254aeb368650
- Computing unit: Cost of an API call, this is use to rate limit the API calls. More on it at [our document](https://docs.pendle.finance/pendle-v2/Developers/Backend/BackendAndHostedSDK#rate-limiting)
- APY/APR/ROI Format: All APY, APR, and ROI values are returned as decimals. For example, 0.5 means 50%, 0.05 means 5%, 1.2 means 120%
- Percentage Change Format: All percentage change values (e.g., 24h changes) are returned as decimals. For example, 0.05 means 5% change
- Logarithmic Values: Some fields like `lnImpliedRate` are natural logarithms. To get the actual rate, use e^(value)

## Recommended way to fetch data

We have a lot of markets, if you call an API for each market, it will be very slow and you will likely get rate limited. Therefore, in some APIs we support fetch all data at once (example the get all markets data, get all assets data/prices), you could use that to fetch all data at once. They also support filter by asset id, type, so if you don't want to fetch, you can filter it down to the specific ones you want.

For detailed documentation, visit:

[https://docs.pendle.finance/pendle-v2/Developers/Backend/ApiOverview](https://docs.pendle.finance/pendle-v2/Developers/Backend/ApiOverview)

## Support

- We have a telegram for developers to ask about the API at [https://t.me/peepo_the_engineer_bot](https://t.me/peepo_the_engineer_bot)
- We have an announcement channel for API updates at [https://t.me/pendledevelopers](https://t.me/pendledevelopers), follow it to get the latest updates on the API.

## FAQ

- How to fetch prices for assets?

  * Use [Get asset prices by IDs](#tag/assets/get/v1/prices/assets)
- What if i want real time prices?

  * Price in our systems are calculate every 15 seconds. However, if you want real time prices, use [Swapping price](#tag/sdk/get/v1/sdk/{chainId}/markets/{market}/swapping-prices), it return price for PT/YT when swapping with underlying token and vice versa, we don't have real time prices for other assets.
- Can i use the SDK to get price, instead of using the `swapping-price` endpoint?

  * **Don't use the SDK to get the price**, we don't recommend it. SDK endpoints are designed for you to get the calldata for **sending transaction**, not for getting the price. Also, SDK endpoints are very costly and will get rate limited easily if you use it to get price of many tokens. 
- How to get token names, expiries, etc?

  * Use [Get asset metadata by IDs](#tag/assets/get/v1/assets/all)
- Do you have historical data, breakdown to minutes?

  * No we don't, all historical data is aggregated to hourly/daily/weekly data.

netInputFromMaker.description: BigInt string of netInputFromMaker, the unit is the same as making amount

netOutputToMaker.description: BigInt string of netOutputToMaker, the unit is SY if the order is PT_FOR_TOKEN or YT_FOR_TOKEN, otherwise, the unit it PT or YT depends on type of order

feeAmount.description: BigInt string of feeAmount, in SY

notionalVolume.description: BigInt string of notionalVolume, in SY

netToMakerIfFullyFilled.description: In SY if the order is PY for token

netFromMakerIfFullyFilled.description: The difference with currentMakingAmount is that this is in SY if currentMakingAmount in tokenIn

signature.description: Signature of order, signed by maker

salt.description: BigInt string of salt. Salt is a random generated number to distinguish between orders.Because of some technical reason, this number must be dividable by 12421

expiry.description: BigInt string of expiry, in second

token.description: Token used by user to make order

makingAmount.description: BigInt string of making amount, the amount of token if the order is TOKEN_FOR_PT or TOKEN_FOR_YT, otherwise the amount of PT or YT

currentMakingAmount.description: BigInt string of remaining making amount, the unit is the same as makingAmount

lnImpliedRate.description: BigInt string of lnImpliedRate. Natural logarithm of the implied rate

makerBalance.description: Min(maker balance, maker allowance). How much token the maker has available to use for this order

failedMintSy.description: Simulate result of the order to mint sy

failedMintSyReason.description: Error reason of the order to mint sy

orderBookBalance.description: Bigint string of amount shown on order book

token.description: Input token if type is TOKEN_FOR_PT or TOKEN_FOR_YT, output token otherwise

makingAmount.description: BigInt string of making amount, the amount of token if the order is TOKEN_FOR_PT or TOKEN_FOR_YT, otherwise the amount of PT or YT

impliedApy.description: Implied APY of this limit order

expiry.description: Timestamp of order's expiry, in seconds

salt.description: BigInt string of salt. Salt is a random generated number to distinguish between orders.Because of some technical reason, this number must be dividable by 12421

nonce.description: Nonce of the limit order, this will help the maker to cancel all the limit order they created

token.description: Input token if type is TOKEN_FOR_PT or TOKEN_FOR_YT, output token otherwise

makingAmount.description: BigInt string of making amount, the amount of token if the order is TOKEN_FOR_PT or TOKEN_FOR_YT, otherwise the amount of PT or YT

token.description: Input token if type is TOKEN_FOR_PT or TOKEN_FOR_YT, output token otherwise

makingAmount.description: BigInt string of making amount, the amount of token if the order is TOKEN_FOR_PT or TOKEN_FOR_YT, otherwise the amount of PT or YT

lowerImpliedApy.description: Lower implied APY of this scaled order

upperImpliedApy.description: Upper implied APY of this scaled order

orderCount.description: Upper implied APY of this scaled order

expiry.description: Timestamp of order's expiry, in seconds

signature.description: Signature of order, signed by maker

token.description: Token used by user to make order

makingAmount.description: Amount to be used to fill the order, the unit is the same as the unit of limit order' making amount

netFromTaker.description: Amount from taker need to fully fill this order, the unit is SY if the market order is TOKEN_FOR_PT or TOKEN_FOR_YT, otherwise, the unit it PT or YT depends on type of order

netToTaker.description: Actual making amount to taker, the unit is SY if the market order is PT_FOR_TOKEN or YT_FOR_TOKEN, otherwise, the unit it PT or YT depends on type of order

limit.description: Number of assets limited by the query

total.description: Total number of data points available

timeFrame.description: Time frame of each OHLCV data point (e.g., "1h", "1d", "1w")

timestamp_start.description: Start timestamp of the data range in seconds

timestamp_end.description: End timestamp of the data range in seconds

results.description: Resulting CSV string following the format: time,open,high,low,close,volume

addresses.description: Addresses of returned assets, can be mapped by index with priceUsd array

pricesUsd.description: Price in usd of mapped asset, can be mapped by index with addresses array, return null if the asset doesnt have price

timestamps.description: List of timestamps, each will be mapped to a notional volume

volumes.description: List of notional volumes corresponding to each timestamp. It has the same length with timestamps array

ammVolumes.description: List of AMM volumes corresponding to each timestamp. It has the same length with timestamps array. Defaults to 0 if not available.

limitOrderVolumes.description: List of Limit Order volumes corresponding to each timestamp. It has the same length with timestamps array. Defaults to 0 if not available.

time.description: Timestamp of the OHLCV data point

open.description: Opening price at the start of the time period

high.description: Highest price during the time period

low.description: Lowest price during the time period

close.description: Closing price at the end of the time period

volume.description: Trading volume during the time period

total.description: Total number of data points available

currency.description: Currency of the price data (e.g., USD)

timeFrame.description: Time frame of each OHLCV data point (e.g., "hour", "day", "week")

timestamp_start.description: Start timestamp of the data range

timestamp_end.description: End timestamp of the data range

limit.description: Number of assets limited by the query

liquidity.description: market liquidity in USD, this is the liquidity of PT and SY in the AMM

totalTvl.description: market total TVL (including floating PT that are not in the AMM) in USD

swapFeeApy.description: swap fee APY for LP holders, without boosting

movement10Percent.description: Amount of PT and YT (in USD) to move the implied yield of market by 10% up or down

aggregatedApy.description: APY including yield, swap fee and Pendle rewards without boosting

maxBoostedApy.description: APY when maximum boost is applies

totalSupply.description: total supply of the LP token

totalActiveSupply.description: total active supply of the LP token, used for calculate boosting

details.description: Market details including liquidity, APY, fee rate, and yield range

aggregatedApy.description: APY including yield, swap fee and Pendle rewards without boosting

maxBoostedApy.description: APY when maximum boost is applies

details.description: Market details including liquidity, APY, fee rate, and yield range

sySupplyCap.description: Sy supply cap. Only available for sy with cap, otherwise null. Number is in decimal format

syCurrentSupply.description: Sy current supply. Only available for sy with cap, otherwise null. Number is in decimal format

extendedInfo.description: Additional market data, only available when market is whitelisted.

isNew.description: Market which whitelisted in the last 2 weeks will have isNew==true

id.description: Unique identifier of the market in format "{chainId}-{address}"

chainId.description: Chain ID where the market is deployed

expiry.description: Expiry date of the PT/YT tokens

accountingAsset.description: Asset used for accounting and pricing in this market

underlyingAsset.description: The underlying asset that generates yield

assetRepresentation.description: String representation of the asset type for this market

isWhitelistedPro.description: Whether this market is whitelisted for pro interface

isWhitelistedSimple.description: Whether this market is whitelisted for simple interface

votable.description: Whether this market can receive vePENDLE votes

isActive.description: Whether the market is currently active (not expired and not manually deactivated)

isWhitelistedLimitOrder.description: Whether limit orders are enabled for this market

totalLp.description: Total supply of the LP token

totalActiveSupply.description: Total active supply of the LP token, used for calculate boosting

liquidity.description: Market liquidity, this is the liquidity of PT and SY in the AMM

underlyingInterestApy.description: Annual percentage yield from the underlying asset interest

underlyingRewardApy.description: Annual percentage yield from the underlying asset rewards

ytFloatingApy.description: Floating APY for YT holders (underlyingApy - impliedApy)

ptDiscount.description: PT discount relative to underlying asset

swapFeeApy.description: Swap fee APY for LP holders, without boosting

aggregatedApy.description: APY including yield, swap fee and Pendle rewards without boosting

maxBoostedApy.description: APY when maximum boost is applied

voterApy.description: APY for voters (vePENDLE holders) from voting on this pool

ytRoi.description: Return on investment for YT holders

ptRoi.description: Return on investment for PT holders

underlyingInterestApyChange24h.description: 24-hour change in underlying interest APY (in percentage points)

underlyingRewardApyChange24h.description: 24-hour change in underlying reward APY (in percentage points)

underlyingApyChange24h.description: 24-hour change in underlying APY (in percentage points)

impliedApyChange24h.description: 24-hour change in implied APY (in percentage points)

ytFloatingApyChange24h.description: 24-hour change in YT floating APY (in percentage points)

ptDiscountChange24h.description: 24-hour change in PT discount (in percentage points)

swapFeeApyChange24h.description: 24-hour change in swap fee APY (in percentage points)

pendleApyChange24h.description: 24-hour change in PENDLE APY (in percentage points)

aggregatedApyChange24h.description: 24-hour change in aggregated APY (in percentage points)

lpRewardApyChange24h.description: 24-hour change in LP reward APY (in percentage points)

voterApyChange24h.description: 24-hour change in voter APY (in percentage points)

categoryIds.description: Array of category IDs this market belongs to

timestamp.description: Timestamp when the market data was last updated

extendedInfo.description: Additional market data, only available when market is whitelisted.

isNew.description: Market which whitelisted in the last 2 weeks will have isNew==true

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the market data snapshot

liquidity.description: Market liquidity, this is the liquidity of PT and SY in the AMM

totalTvl.description: Market total TVL (including floating PT that are not in the AMM)

underlyingInterestApy.description: Annual percentage yield from the underlying asset interest

underlyingRewardApy.description: Annual percentage yield from the underlying asset rewards

ytFloatingApy.description: Floating APY for YT holders (underlyingApy - impliedApy)

swapFeeApy.description: Swap fee APY for LP holders, without boosting

voterApy.description: APY for voters (vePENDLE holders) from voting on this pool

ptDiscount.description: PT discount relative to underlying asset

aggregatedApy.description: APY including yield, swap fee and Pendle rewards without boosting

maxBoostedApy.description: APY when maximum boost is applied

estimatedDailyPoolRewards.description: Estimated daily pool rewards broken down by asset

totalLp.description: Total supply of the LP token

totalActiveSupply.description: Total active supply of the LP token, used for calculate boosting

assetPriceUsd.description: Price of the accounting asset in USD

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the APY data point

total.description: total data point of the result

results.description: csv result with 4 column: timestamp,maxApy,baseApy,tvl. Timestamp is in second, tvl is in usd

maxApy.description: APY when maximum boost is applied

baseApy.description: APY including yield, swap fee and Pendle rewards without boosting

tvl.description: Market liquidity (TVL in the pool) in USD

totalTvl.description: Market total TVL (including floating PT that are not in the AMM) in USD

underlyingInterestApy.description: Annual percentage yield from the underlying asset interest

underlyingRewardApy.description: Annual percentage yield from the underlying asset rewards

ytFloatingApy.description: Floating APY for YT holders (underlyingApy - impliedApy)

swapFeeApy.description: Swap fee APY for LP holders, without boosting

voterApr.description: APY for voters (vePENDLE holders) from voting on this pool

totalSupply.description: Total supply of the LP token

explicitSwapFee.description: Explicit swap fee in USD (only available for daily and weekly timeframes)

implicitSwapFee.description: Implicit swap fee in USD (only available for daily and weekly timeframes)

limitOrderFee.description: Limit order fee in USD (only available for daily and weekly timeframes)

total.description: Total number of data points available

timestamp_start.description: Start timestamp of the data range

timestamp_end.description: End timestamp of the data range

tvl.description: Array of tvl (market liquidity in USD)

underlyingInterestApy.description: Array of underlying interest APY. 0.5 means 50%

underlyingRewardApy.description: Array of underlying reward APY. 0.5 means 50%

ytFloatingApy.description: Array of YT floating APY. 0.5 means 50%

swapFeeApy.description: Array of swap fee APY. 0.5 means 50%

lpRewardApy.description: Array of LP reward APY. 0.5 means 50%

explicitSwapFee.description: Array of explicit swap fee (in USD). Only available for daily and weekly timeframes

implicitSwapFee.description: Array of implicit swap fee (in USD). Only available for daily and weekly timeframes

limitOrderFee.description: Array of limit order fee (in USD). Only available for daily and weekly timeframes

amount.description: Bigint string of the amount required to swap in the market to change the implied apy to XXX

currentSwapFee.description: Swap fees collected in current epoch (in USD)

lastEpochSwapFee.description: Swap fees collected in last epoch (in USD)

projectedVoterApr.description: Projected voter APR for next epoch

expectedCap.description: Expected incentive cap for next epoch (BigInt string)

currentCap.description: Current incentive cap for this epoch (BigInt string)

totalPendleLocked.description: Total amount of PENDLE tokens locked in vePENDLE

totalProjectedVotes.description: Total projected votes for next epoch

pools.description: List of voting pools with their APY, fees, and voting data

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the token supply data

totalPendleCirculating.description: Total circulating supply of PENDLE tokens (not locked)

totalPendleLocked.description: Total amount of PENDLE tokens locked in vePENDLE

revenues.description: The revenues of the month in USD within the time range

epochStartDates.description: The start dates of the month in Date within the time range

totalPendleLocked.description: Total amount of PENDLE tokens locked in vePENDLE

totalProjectedVotes.description: Total projected votes for next epoch

pools.description: List of voting pools with their APY, fees, and voting data

tokenSupply.description: Current circulating and total supply of PENDLE tokens

monthlyRevenue.description: Monthly protocol revenue breakdown and trends

time.description: timestamp where total fee is being calculated

values.description: Values of given metadata keys in the same order with keys
Values of given metadata keys in the same order with keys

tokensMintSy.description: tokens can be use for tokenMintSy

tokensRedeemSy.description: tokens can be use for tokenRedeemSy

tokensIn.description: input tokens of swap or zap function

tokensOut.description: output tokens of swap or zap function

name.description: Name of the aggregator, e.g., kyberswap, okx, odos, paraswap

computingUnit.description: Computing unit required for the aggregator

aggregators.description: List of supported aggregators with their computing units

underlyingToken.description: underlying token address that will be used for swapping

underlyingTokenToPtRate.description: number of PT by swapping 1 underlying token. If the swap can not be done, this value will be null

ptToUnderlyingTokenRate.description: number of underlying token by swapping 1 PT. If the swap can not be done, this value will be null

underlyingTokenToYtRate.description: number of YT by swapping 1 underlying token. If the swap can not be done, this value will be null

ytToUnderlyingTokenRate.description: number of underlying token by swapping 1 YT. If the swap can not be done, this value will be null

impliedApy.description: implied apy of the given market

amount.description: Amount of input tokens used for swapping

receiver.description: The address to receive the output of the action

slippage.description: Max slippage accepted. A value from 0 to 1 (0.01 is 1%)

aggregators.description: List of aggregator names to use for the swap. If not provided, all aggregators will be used.List of supported aggregator can be found at: [getSupportedAggregators](#/SDK/SdkController_getSupportedAggregators)

outputs.description: Output token amounts from the action

inputs.description: Input token amounts for the action

pairedTokensOut.description: Array of token addresses that the PT can be swapped to

market.description: Market address where the transaction occurred

chainId.description: Chain ID where the transaction occurred

impliedApy.description: Weighted average implied APY for this transaction

notional.description: Notional amounts traded (only for TRADES type)

skip.description: Number of results skipped for pagination

resumeToken.description: Resume token for pagination. Use this to continue a previous query. Use this token in the next request. Can be undefined if the query is at the end of the results.

users.description: Array of unique wallet addresses (lowercase) that have interacted with the specified token. Addresses are deduplicated across both Sentio and internal data sources.

wlpUsers.description: Array of distinct user addresses that have interacted with WLP

moneyMarket.description: The address of the money market

distinctUsers.description: Distinct users for the LP token

liquidLockerPools.description: Liquid locker pools info for LP token

wlpDistinctUsersResponse.description: WLP users and related info for WLP token, only available for wrapped market

wlpHolderMappings.description: WLP holder mappings for WLP token

merkleRoot.description: Merkle root hash of the merkle tree

crossPts.description: list of cross chain pt data

activeBalance.description: Active balance of the position (for LP only)

valuation.description: Valuation of the position in USD

closedPositions.description: Array of closed user token positions

updatedAt.description: Date time of the last update

errorMessage.description: Error message when there is something wrong

spent_v2.description: Total spent to purchase this asset

profit.description: Profit or loss of the transaction

txValueAsset.description: Total value of the transaction in asset

ptExchangeRate.description: PT exchange rate at the time of the transaction

effectivePtExchangeRate.description: Effective PT exchange rate of this transaction

ptExchangeRateAfter.description: PT exchange rate of market after the transaction

txHash.description: Transaction hash, some event does not have this field, example: merkle reward distribution

dexKey.description: Dex key. Result is always pendle.

priceNative.description: Price of asset0 quoted in asset1

tvl.description: Total Value Locked as a string

apr.description: Annual Percentage Rate in decimal format
